creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund
marks: Signature and Date LR in black: [ALEX. FOURNIER \'88]
provenance:
(Possibly Beard Art Galleries, Minneapolis, Minnesota). Gordon Bates, Minneapolis, Minnesota;[1] purchased by MIA in 1946.

[1] Gordon Bates was the brother of Edmund E. Bates, who also owned works by Fournier in the MIA collection (see 'Farnham's Mill at St. Anthony Falls, Minneapolis', 44.23). In the Edmund Bates correspondence, he mentions that his brother Gordon owns four or five similar 'Minneapolis' pictures by Fournier.
text: This view of the Mill Pond in Minneapolis was painted from the west side of the river, looking toward the University and shows the stone arch bridge completed in 1883 by James J. Hill's Union-Northern Pacific Railroad.
title: Mill Pond at Minneapolis
